{
    "number": 201818,
    "data": "1,2,4,5,8,9,11,12,15,16,17,18,19,22,26,29,30,33,34,38,39,41,43,45,50,51,52,54,55,57,60,67,72,73,74,78,79,85,86,87,89,92,93,95,96,97,100,103,107,108,109,110,111,115,121,123,125,131,134,136,137,141",
    "name": "Numbers n such that 90*n + 49 is prime.",
    "comment": [
        "This sequence was generated by adding 14 Fibonacci-like sequences. Looking at the format 90n+49 modulo 9 and modulo 10 we see that all entries of A142314 have digital root 2 and last digit 9. (Reverting the process is an application of the Chinese remainder theorem.)"
    ],
    "link": [
        "Vincenzo Librandi, <a href=\"/A201818/b201818.txt\">Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000</a>"
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "Select[Range[0, 200], PrimeQ[90 # + 49] &] (* _T. D. Noe_, Dec 06 2011 *)"
    ],
    "program": [
        "(MAGMA) [n: n in [0..200] | IsPrime(90*n+49)] // Vincenzo Librandi, Dec 11 2011",
        "(PARI) is(n)=isprime(90*n+49) \\\\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Feb 17 2017"
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn,easy",
    "offset": "1,2",
    "author": "_J. W. Helkenberg_, Dec 05 2011",
    "references": 15,
    "revision": 14,
    "time": "2017-02-17T12:05:37-05:00",
    "created": "2011-12-06T17:09:16-05:00"
}
